trial_identification.scientifictitle: To establish from the data analysis of nicotine addicted trial participants, whether or not a permanent behavioural shift can occur as a result of undertaking the Freedom from Smoking Programme.

conditions.healthcondition: Drug addiction / substance abuse, primarily nicotine

interventions.interventions: To establish from the data analysis of trial participants, whether or not a permanent behavioural shift from addiction can occur as a result of undertking the Freedom From Smoking Programme for 2 - 4 weeks. The study assessment period for each patient (participant) is 2 years. Measurements will be made at the beginning of the programme, at 2 weeks, 4 weeks, 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 2 years.

primaryOutcome.outcome: To free people worldwide from harmful addictions, primarily nicotine at this stage.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: The time point is 2 - 4 weeks direct intervention time.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: To prove that successful outcomes can occur through the healing of the psychological cause of addiction and that patients can remain addiction free within time frames of reassessment over a 2 year period.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At time intervals to assess measurable outcomes at 3, 6, 12, 18 months.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The Freedom from Smoking programme is a successful medium to achieve this outcome.

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Freedom Team Foundation Inc. No A0039188D

ethicsAndSummary.summary: To participate in a 14 day, self help programme consisting of a 99 page manual, 2 CD's and workbook with optional teaching if required. A confidential, in depth trial questionnaire to be answered by the participant in order to interpret and analyse the success or otherwise of the programme, taking into account individual criterion of each participant.
